title: Lecture 8
content:
Class Definition Which of the following is a good and valid definition for a class representing a car?
def class Car(object): close class Car(object): check def Car(object): close class A(object) close Check   Show Solution Viewing videos requires an internet connection View video page Download video Download transcript Class Instance Using the class definition below, which line creates a new Car object with 4 wheels and 2 doors?
class Car(object):def __init__(self, w, d):self.wheels = wself.doors = dself.color = "" Car(mycar, 4, 2) close mycar = Car(4, 2, “white”) close mycar = Car(4, 2) check mycar = Car(2, 4) close Check   Show Solution Viewing videos requires an internet connection View video page Download video Download transcript Methods Which of the following methods changes the color of the car, based on the definition below?
class Car(object):def __init__(self, w, d):self.wheels = wself.doors = dself.color = "" def paint(c):color = cclose def paint(self, c):color = cclose def paint(c):self.c = cclose def paint(self, c):self.color = ccheck Check   Show Solution Viewing videos requires an internet connection View video page Download video Download transcript Method Call You create a car with mycar = Car(4, 2). Which is a line of code to change the color of mycar to “red”?
class Car(object):def __init__(self, w, d):self.wheels = wself.doors = dself.color = ""def paint(self, c):self.color = c Car.paint(“red”) close mycar.paint(red) close mycar.paint(“red”) check mycar.paint(Car, “red”) close Check   Show Solution Viewing videos requires an internet connection View video page Download video Download transcript Special Methods With the code below, what does the line print(mycar == yourcar) print?
class Car(object):def __init__(self, w, d):self.wheels = wself.doors = dself.color = ""def paint(self, c):self.color = cdef __eq__(self, other):if self.wheels == other.wheels and \self.color == other.color and \self.doors == other.doors:return Trueelse:return Falsemycar = Car(4, 2)mycar.paint("red")yourcar = Car(4,2)print(mycar == yourcar) True close False check An error close Check   Show Solution Viewing videos requires an internet connection View video page Download video Download transcript
